dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4072 IH: To prohibit the use of funds appropriated to any Federal department or agency to provide technical assistance to nongovernment entities for the production of motion pictures, television shows, and other audiovisual programs.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Barrow of Georgia introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of funds appropriated to any Federal department or agency to provide technical assistance to nongovernment entities for the production of motion pictures, television shows, and other audiovisual programs.

section.header: Prohibition on use of Federal funds to provide technical assistance for motion pictures, television shows, and other audiovisual programs
section.text: No Federal department or agency may obligate or expend funds appropriated to the department or agency for a fiscal year to provide technical assistance to any nongovernment entity for the production of any motion picture, television show, documentary, music videos, commercial advertisement, CDâ€“ROM game, or other audiovisual program.
